text: date: mon, 20 dec 1999 16:13:56 -0500 from: sklein@mint.netto: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: the amazon of all boycottsi am writing in regards to the article on amazon.com boycott ("the amazon of all boycotts," 18.dec.99). the first line reads, "richard stallman is one of the original developers of what becamethe linux os...."while the contributions of rms are great, crediting him with linux is unfair to linus torvalds, creator of the linux kernel and figurehead for the linux community. without the talent of rms, linux would be using different tools and libraries; without the talent of linus, you wouldn't be mentioning the gnu project.it is to be noted that linux wasn't using the gnu libc until a few years ago. linux had it's own libc. also, the gnu c compiler is not specific to linux. not only is it the easiest compiler to port to new systems, but it is also popular....i do hope we'll see a true gnu system some day, whatever kernel it uses. a system produced under the direction of a man like rms would be fascinating.
